intro: Uragoga hirtipes, commonly known as the hairy uragoga, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, white or yellowish flowers that are clustered in umbels. Uragoga hirtipes is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
